item.title: Loose paving slabs, 17th December
item.description:
There are several paving slabs that are loose and uneven outside the houses in Corinthian Manorway and it is especially dangerous whilst it is dark as the street lighting is blocked by the trees that over hang in the road and in our gardens!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinthian Manorway, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: Dangerous intersection, 17th December
item.description:
Yesterday a car went straight through the intersection when I was driving up Church Road towards the church. It was a narrow miss. Suggest painting the road lines and putting a give way sign for those choosing to take the immediate right turn from kingswood Road (to go down Church Road) from the direction of Harris Shortlands primary.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive wide and deep potholes, danger to cyclists, 17th December
item.description:
On the Essex Road from the junction with Englefield Road south as far as the junction with Upper Street there are extensive wide and deep potholes. Many of them are concentrated a foot away from the kerb, meaning as a cyclist if you hit them you risk falling off or constantly need to move right in the roadway into traffic to avoid them. They are on both the southbound and northbound carriageways, particularly bad southbound.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 302-304, Essex Road, Islington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1A, Foots Cray Lane, Albany Park, Greater London

item.title: Poor surface, 17th December
item.description:
The cobbled entrance to New Inn Road from Curtain Road has been consistently breaking up, and the rest of the first part of the road needs serious resurfacing. Previous broken cobbles have been filled in with tarmac. This is both a poor, temporary solution and an eye-sore. Please replace the cobbles and fix the rest of the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, New Inn Yard, Shoreditch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Confusing Road Layout and Missing Markings on Charterhouse Street, 17th December
item.description:
There is an ongoing safety issue regarding the unclear road layout and lack of signage on Charterhouse Street. When travelling northeast on Charterhouse Street toward Charterhouse Square, the road bears right and becomes Lindsay Street (southeast). To continue straight toward Charterhouse Square, drivers must turn off Charterhouse Street and signal left. This layout is counterintuitive, as it appears that continuing straight should follow the main line of the road, when in fact it requires a turning manoeuvre. This confusion regularly leads to dangerous situations. Many drivers fail to signal left onto Charterhouse Square and instead continue following the bend into Lindsay Street. As a cyclist, I have witnessed and experienced several near misses at this junction as a result. The road markings are badly faded or missing, and there are no clear signs indicating that the main route does not continue straight ahead. Unless this issue is addressed proactively, a serious collision is likely. I urge that clear road markings, advance warning signs, and directional arrows be installed to make the layout unambiguous. From past experience with the police and TfL, such hazards are often addressed only after an accident. I strongly recommend taking preventative action now to improve safety at this busy and confusing junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Smithfield, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
